misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that printing a string literal space (' ') immediately after printing the number inside the loop will handle the spacing, and they must check if the current index is less than the last index (n-1) to avoid a trailing space.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The student successfully handles the core array logic (shifting) but demonstrates a common off-by-one or boundary condition difficulty when formatting output. While the conditional `if(i<n-1)System.out.print(" ");` is the standard way to prevent a trailing space, the student missed including a space in the output of the last element's print statement. Since `System.out.print(y[i]);` is used, the numbers are concatenated directly (e.g., '4123') without separation, even when the conditional space is printed.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: wrong output (concatenated numbers instead of space-separated numbers)
